Author: jansako#3330
Content: Just FY, I am seeing a bit of an issue with the payout feature. (z-nomp release) It seems to  'keep some' of the mined coin back, so there is a slowly ever increasing amount left on the pool wallet. It is quite a significant amount actually, so keep an eye on that. It does not do it for KMD for some reason, but it does it for the AC with those miniscule block rewards.

Author: jansako#3330
Content: wrong tag, meant @xRobeSx

Author: jansako#3330
Content: Anyone else sees that? You may not even notice if you just set up the payout and not look at the original deposit wallet...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you might have the txfee set to the wrong size in the 'coins' folder

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: 0.0001 I think is the exact value

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: 0.00005 was in robes configs

Author: jansako#3330
Content: Yes, I have it at 0.00005

Author: jansako#3330
Content: It is still sending though, so how come it keeps some back?

Author: jansako#3330
Content: and it always sends the KMD reward

Author: Alright#0419
Content: txfee only matters if you use the payment processor

Author: jansako#3330
Content: yes, I do

Author: Alright#0419
Content: well actually shouldn't matter at all, as the txs will get confirmed with a lower fee anyway

Author: jansako#3330
Content: and it does pay out, just not all the mined coins, there is an ever increasing amount that stays behind

Author: jansako#3330
Content: I will fix the fee on half of the AC's, see what it does üòÉ

Author: jansako#3330
Content: could it be the 'maxBlocksPerPayment' value? If I mine more than the specified number over the payout period? I have it set to 600 blocks over 570 payment interval. I have the payment intervals set staggered, cause I though maybe the payouts are not going out cause all of them are trying to send at the same time...

Author: jansako#3330
Content: actually no way one can mine 600 blocks in 9.5 minutes, so that can't be it...

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content:
I had a quick questions from a newb:

Is it possible to run one machine and have different GPU's pointed to Different pools/stratums?

E.G.:

zm --server stratum.web.services --port 3123 --user wallet.id  --color --dev GPU0
zm --server stratum.notthesameweb.services --port 3103 --user wallet.id  --color --dev GPU1


etc... etc... ? 

If not this way, could it be done with the --cfg-file command?

Thank you in advance.

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: This is in DSTM

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
` --dev            Space separated list of cuda devices to use.
                     If this option is not given all available devices are used.`

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: @FishyGuts üëÜüèø

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: So I did that and entered gpu0 and it still fired up all devices.  Let me try again  make sure I did it right.

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: Do I need to enter gpu0 + GeForce blahblablah?

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: try `--list-devices` and see if `gpu0` is actually the right thing to use or maybe it needs `0`

Author: bishop#9773
Content: probably just numbers 0, 1, 2

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: So I have 12 gpus.  Just trying to get to define which GPUs are mining which chain.   Instead of having them all on one.

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: Looks like this - - dev 0 works

Content: It‚Äôs just mining one card even though it‚Äôs listing them all to start.   Thank you.
